Events that occurred on 26 September.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1902 - Academic Clyde S. Kilby is born.
1947 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Jennifer Brookes-Smith.
1947 - Voice actor Graham Faulkner is born.
1980 - Oxonmoot 1980 at The Turf Tavern.
1981 - Oxonmoot 1981 at The Turf Tavern.
1982 - Oxonmoot 1982 at the Cotswold Lodge Hotel.
1987 - Oxonmoot 1987 at Oxford Town Hall.
1998 - Oxonmoot 1998 at Exeter College.
1999 - Oxonmoot 1999 at Exeter College.
2002 - I.L. Gordon dies.
2002 - The Xbox version of The Fellowship of the Ring are released in North America.
2006 - Fantasy novel Here, There Be Dragons, featuring J.R.R. Tolkien as a fictional character, is published.
2008 - Oxonmoot 2008 at Christ Church.
2009 - Oxonmoot 2009 at Lady Margaret Hall.
2010 - Oxonmoot 2010 at Lady Margaret Hall.
2010 - Lasse Lanta Autumn Meeting of Austrian Tolkien Society.
2010 - Decentennial Celebration and Hobbit Birthdays, North East Tolkien Society.
2012 - Tolkien's World: A Guide to the Peoples and Places of Middle-Earth by Gareth Hanrahan and Peter McKinstry is published.
2019 - Tolkien's Lost Chaucer is published.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
The Hobbits leave Fredegar Bolger back in Crickhollow to impersonate Frodo. They enter the Old Forest.
They encounter Old Man Willow and are rescued by Tom Bombadil who hosts them to his house. Frodo dreams about Gandalf.
Two Nazg√ªl come to Bree from the South road.
Gandalf hurries towards The Shire on Shadowfax.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
